title: A1: Beginner German
description: Learn German with Spektrum Deutsch A1 textbook - Complete (Chapters 1-12)

courses.title: Chapter 1: Hallo und guten Tag
courses.description: Greetings, introductions, countries, languages, hobbies, and basic conversation (pages 11-28)

courses.title: Chapter 2: Beruf und Familie
courses.description: Professions, everyday objects, family members, possessive articles, and work-related conversations (pages 27-50)

courses.title: Chapter 3: In der Stadt
courses.description: City places, ordering in a café, hotels, accusative case, past tense of sein, and describing cities (pages 49-72)

courses.title: Chapter 4: Von morgens bis abends
courses.description: Daily routines, telling time, days of the week, separable verbs, modal verb können, and phone conversations (pages 71-94)

courses.title: Chapter 5: Essen und Trinken
courses.description: Food and drinks, eating habits, restaurants, kitchen vocabulary, verb mögen, and negation (pages 93-112)

courses.title: Chapter 6: Gestern und heute
courses.description: Perfect tense, reporting past activities, university life, and describing experiences (pages 113+)

courses.title: Chapter 7: Unterwegs
courses.description: Transportation, weather and seasons, travel, postcards, dative case, and modal verb wollen

courses.title: Chapter 8: Was man so braucht
courses.description: Shopping, clothing, colors, travel essentials, modal verb müssen, adjective declension, and giving reasons

courses.title: Chapter 9: Arbeit, Probleme, Termine
courses.description: Office activities, describing problems, dates, appointments, phone conversations, and ordinal numbers

courses.title: Chapter 10: Freizeit und Gesundheit
courses.description: Leisure activities, body parts, health, doctor visits, modal verb sollen, imperative, and healthy living

courses.title: Chapter 11: Wohnen
courses.description: Housing types, rooms, furniture, directions, household activities, superlative, and modal verb dürfen

courses.title: Chapter 12: Ein Wochenende in Berlin
courses.description: Tourist attractions, events, invitations, congratulations, future with werden, and past tense of modal verbs
